subject: Coming to LA II
event:
Plans for my January visit to LA continue to come together.

The signing has now been set.  I will be autographing books at VROMAN'S, an independent bookstore in Pasadena, on Sunday, January 9, from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm.

http://www.vromansbookstore.com

(The event is not yet listed on their website, but I assume it will be up soon.  My thanks to them for putting this together on such short notice.  Usually signings like this are set up months in advance)

Given the limited time window we have for this event, I may not be speaking or answering questions, as I usually do at bookstore appearances.  It all depends on how many people turn up.  If the crowd is large, I may need to start scribbling right away to make certain that everyone gets a book signed.  I don't like anyone to go away disappointed... but my schedule is such that I will probably need to be out of there at 7:00 pm, hell or high water.

Looking forward to meeting some of you there.  (However briefly)

comments.upictitle: Lucy: ASOIAF: Daenerys ASOIAF: Daenerys dragon
comments.article: Yay, I will be there :)
Hopefully you can make it to Northern California eventually.

yes! George, there are many of us up here who would love to see you...

I work at a small independent bookstore/cafe in Sonoma County, and if GRRM was going to speak and/or sign books with fifty miles of us, several of my coworkers and I would probably die of excitement before we made it to the place :)
Wish I could be there!
That's like.. a mile from me, so I'll definitely stop by.  Looking forward to it.
comments.subject: Vroman's

comments.article:
I'm going home (SoCal) for Christmas, and will be back in Dallas in January.

Vromans is a great little bookstore in Pasadena, used to be my hood. I recommend parking in the back, off of Oak Knoll (crosses Colorado Blvd between Vroman's and Target). If a lot of people are showing up, park in the Target lot directly east of Vroman's parking (also off Oak Knoll - http://bit.ly/g2jRLl), then find the Vromans entrance in the back.
comments.subject: Of Course I'll just miss it.

comments.article: Maybe I'm an oddball, but I'd rather hear you talk / read than get a book signed.  If there's only enough time for one or the other, cut the signing, not the reading!
Anne Rice just had a signing there a few days ago.  Sounds like a cool bookstore.  Wish I lived in the area. (Except for the fact that I hate LA.)

My friend was at that book signing!

I will definitely be there George! So excited!! First ever book signing.

Does it have to be a new book? My copy of A Game of Thrones is a little dented but should still look good. Should I take all 4 of them? Agh can't wait!

comments.upictitle: Avox in Arcadia: Everything Is Changing
comments.article: I'm so glad the icon of you with the baby tiger is back.
When are you coming to beautiful Columbus, Ohio?  I'll bring you cupcakes!

Vroman's is a terrific bookstore, I think you'll be pleased. I have noticed that the GRRM books always have the "employee recommends" cards beneath them- which is endearing, don't you think?

AND they carry Peadar's book. Also endearing.
CANNOT wait :D I'll probably be there with a half dozen girlfriends. Looking forward just getting to see you in person if it ends up being too crowded to get something signed.
I'll be gound hamburger from a week long camping trip in the snow, but I wouldn't miss it.  Yeah, I'll be the big bald dork in the Stark T-Shirt. Bet I wont be alone...HA! Rise up brothers!
comments.subject: My Old Stomping Grounds

comments.article:
I will be there GRRM! Will be there early to get in line.
Cant wait to meet you in person. Oh, and I purchased my subscription to HBO in anticipation of Spring.
:-)
comments.subject: Sweet!

comments.article:
Any chance of maybe a new Ice and Fire sample for Christmas??? I'm in Seattle, so I hope to call the store the day after your signing and see if they have any extras that they would consider shipping. I haven't picked up the Vance tribute book yet.

Cheers to you and yours!
can I bring my copy of A Dance with Dragons to the signing ?
I'll come to any readings that you have close to me!
Can't wait! See you and other fans there.
Any plans for a Los Angeles pizza crawl?
comments.subject: Pizza

comments.article: Man. If I was in the area, it would be the perfect opportunity to buy a third copy of A Game of Thrones. (I've bought it twice already, yes... and I keep giving it away! Others need to read the series, after all.)

Every time I see LA I get all excited until I remember that LA also means Los Angeles.

I don't hold much hope of you stopping by Louisiana any time soon, so hopefully we'll just happen to be going to the same convention one of these days.
Merry Christmas George!!!
My wife used to host the special author events at that store, that's where I met her! Amazing indie bookstore I will try to stop by to shake your hand sir!
comments.subject: Awesome bookstore

comments.article: Merry Christmas George, I hope you have a great time
comments.subject: Merry Christmas

comments.article: Hope you and your family are having a Merry Christmas!  Rest that pen, A Dance of Dragons can be finished in 2011, just in time for someone to get it for me as a Christmas present!
comments.subject: Merry Christmas to my Favorite Author!

comments.article: Come back to Canada. Just once more because I couldn't get to your last visit unfortunately, so you should find an excuse to come back for a book signing to Toronto or something!
comments.subject: From a fanboi
